ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: For each string in a set of strings, determine a unique tag that is a substring of fixed size k unique to that string, if it has one. If no such unique substring exists, the least frequent substring is used. If multiple unique substrings exist, the lexicographically smallest substring is used. This lexicographically smallest substring of size k is called the "UniqTag" of that string.

For each string in a set of strings, determine a unique tag that is a substring of fixed size k unique to that string, if it has one. If no such unique substring exists, the least frequent substring is used. If multiple unique substrings exist, the lexicographically smallest substring is used. This lexicographically smallest substring of size k is called the "UniqTag" of that string.

name: r-uniqtag
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-uniqtag
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/uniqtag_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/uniqtag/uniqtag_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 25ba0731ff61857ea4c1d06c99018ed3b0d1121689b6269b79776371092fad6e

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:

  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('uniqtag')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('uniqtag')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/sjackman/uniqtag
  license: MIT
  summary: For each string in a set of strings, determine a unique tag that is a substring of fixed size k unique to that string, if it has one. If no such unique substring exists, the least frequent substring is used. If multiple unique substrings exist, the lexicographically smallest substring is used. This lexicographically
    smallest substring of size k is called the "UniqTag" of that string.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: uniqtag
# Type: Package
# Version: 1.0
# Title: Abbreviate Strings to Short, Unique Identifiers
# Description: For each string in a set of strings, determine a unique tag that is a substring of fixed size k unique to that string, if it has one. If no such unique substring exists, the least frequent substring is used. If multiple unique substrings exist, the lexicographically smallest substring is used. This lexicographically smallest substring of size k is called the "UniqTag" of that string.
